title.narrative: Comp 1 Outcome 2 National and local PPPs that show improved environmental and sustainability performance following implemented SEA recommendations

description.narrative: SEA applied to selected programmes, policies and plans (PPPs) resulting in practical recommendations that reduce and mitigate negative effects on the environment and enhance the long-term sustainability of the PPPs (this include supports to national level PPPs and TAs via MoHA to provincial/district SEA taskforces.

title.narrative: Comp 1 Outcome 2 National and local PPPs that show improved environmental and sustainability performance following implemented SEA recommendations

description.narrative: SEA applied to selected programmes, policies and plans (PPPs) resulting in practical recommendations that reduce and mitigate negative effects on the environment and enhance the long-term sustainability of the PPPs (this include supports to national level PPPs and TAs via MoHA to provincial/district SEA taskforces.

comment.narrative: SEA is not yet consistently applied and few concretes examples of practical recommendations included in the PPPs

title.narrative: Comp 1 Outcome 5 Number of Central Java PPPs that show improved environmental sustainability following implemented SEA recommendations

description.narrative: SEA is applied to selected provincial policies, plans and programmes resulting in practical recommendations that improve the environmental and sustainable development performance of the PPPs

description.narrative: SEA is applied to selected provincial policies, plans and programmes resulting in practical recommendations that improve the environmental and sustainable development performance of the PPPs

comment.narrative: None

title.narrative: Comp 2 Outcome 6 Indicator: Results of the SSC Energy Programme outputs supported by ESP3 used by the Indonesian government and integrated into for future SSC Energy workplans

description.narrative: Selected outputs (improved modelling and energy planning, extended integration of RE into the grid and reduction of energy demand through EE measures) from the SSC Energy Programme have been implemented with ESP3 financial support

title.narrative: Comp 2 Outcome 6 Indicator: Results of the SSC Energy Programme outputs supported by ESP3 used by the Indonesian government and integrated into for future SSC Energy workplans

description.narrative: Selected outputs (improved modelling and energy planning, extended integration of RE into the grid and reduction of energy demand through EE measures) from the SSC Energy Programme have been implemented with ESP3 financial support

comment.narrative: SSC Energy has limited funds for activities and there are few activities at national level related to energy modeling, RE grid integration and EE

title.narrative: Output 6.4 indicator: Improved understanding of thermal power plant efficiency and flexibility

description.narrative: Study of cost-effective potentials for energy efficiency in thermal power plants, implemented in close collaboration with the Directorate General for Electricity and the national distributor, PLN (focused on EE improvements, flexibility and regulator incentives)

title.narrative: Output 6.4 indicator: Improved understanding of thermal power plant efficiency and flexibility

description.narrative: Study of cost-effective potentials for energy efficiency in thermal power plants, implemented in close collaboration with the Directorate General for Electricity and the national distributor, PLN (focused on EE improvements, flexibility and regulator incentives)

comment.narrative: No information on efficiency or flexibility of Indonesian thermal power plants

title.narrative: Output 6.3 indicator: RE increasingly integrated into the Indonesian electricity grid

description.narrative: Study tour to Denmark to expose 37 Indonesian delegates and stakeholders to Danish modelling and RE integration activities, TA to revise the Indonesian grid code with a focus on the Java-Bali grid (to continue in 2018)

title.narrative: Output 6.3 indicator: RE increasingly integrated into the Indonesian electricity grid

description.narrative: Study tour to Denmark to expose 37 Indonesian delegates and stakeholders to Danish modelling and RE integration activities, TA to revise the Indonesian grid code with a focus on the Java-Bali grid (to continue in 2018)

comment.narrative: Grid code not suitable for high RE penetration

title.narrative: Output 1.1 indicator: National Energy Clearing House established, operational, sustainable and supporting local governments

description.narrative: Sub-regional governments have access to information from the National Energy Clearing House, which serves as an effective tool for them to translate EE/EC policies into local programmes and activities

title.narrative: Output 1.1 indicator: National Energy Clearing House established, operational, sustainable and supporting local governments

description.narrative: Sub-regional governments have access to information from the National Energy Clearing House, which serves as an effective tool for them to translate EE/EC policies into local programmes and activities

comment.narrative: Little information transfer from national to local government on EE and EC and no established mechanism for doing so

title.narrative: Comp 2 outcome 1 Indicator: Sub-regional governments receiving and using information provided by the National Energy Clearing House to develop EE and EC policies, strategies, and plans

description.narrative: Sub-regional governments have the information needed to development and implement EE and EC policies and integrate these into CC strategies and plans and are able to report on EE and EC targets

description.narrative: Sub-regional governments have the information needed to development and implement EE and EC policies and integrate these into CC strategies and plans and are able to report on EE and EC targets

comment.narrative: Little information transfer from national to local government on EE and EC and no established mechanism for doing so

comment.narrative: Little information transfer from national to local government on RE and no established mechanism for doing so
